node.title: SA records two positive COVID-19 cases after borders open to ACT, NSW and Victoria
node.alt: A woman with grey hair in front of a banner
node.description: Two people return positive COVID-19 tests in South Australia, the day after the state's borders opened to NSW, Victoria and the ACT.
node.content:
["Two people have returned positive COVID-19 tests\u00a0in South Australia, the day after the state's borders opened to NSW, Victoria and the ACT.", "The first is not believed to be infectious, while it is unknown whether the other case is infectious or has been in the community.", "Premier Steven Marshall announced the second case this afternoon, but could not provide any further details.", "Chief Public Health Officer Nicola Spurrier announced the first case this morning.", "She said a\u00a0Victorian had returned a positive COVID-19 test\u00a0after arriving in South Australia yesterday.", "The person had COVID-19 about a month ago and tested positive yesterday.", "The infection had already been counted in Victoria's figures, she said.", "The person had received both of their COVID-19 vaccinations.", "South Australia's borders opened to vaccinated travellers from Victoria, NSW and the ACT yesterday, after being closed for months because of outbreaks interstate.", "There were emotional scenes at Adelaide Airport as hundreds of travellers reunited with family members.", "Professor Spurrier yesterday said wastewater testing had returned a \"faint positive\" result in Victor Harbor, but she did not yet have the results of a follow-up test done yesterday.", "\"Another thing I'll be watching out for,\" she said.", "Residents of the south coast town \u2014 which has one of Australia's oldest populations \u2014 have been concerned about the possible effects of an outbreak in coming months.\u00a0", "", "
About 150 vehicles lined up to cross the SA-Victoria border at Bordertown on Monday night.(ABC News: Brant Cumming)
", "About 60,000 people have applied to visit the state using the EntryCheck SA website since new entry requirements were introduced. \u00a0", "Premier Steven Marshall said more visitors would mean more turnover for the local economy. \u00a0", "\"If you look at NSW and Victoria, and in particular Sydney and Melbourne, these are our two largest markets for interstate travellers to South Australia, so this is a massive, massive additional multi-billion-dollar injection into our economy,\" he said.", "
Regional quarantine camps defended
", "Professor Spurrier defended the timing of a tender for regional quarantine facilities for Aboriginal people caught up in COVID-19 outbreaks.", "The tender seeks companies to operate quarantine camps in regional centres for Indigenous people unable to self-isolate safely at home in the event of an outbreak.", "It went out on Monday \u2014 the day before the state's border reopened \u2014 with the closing date of Friday.", "The facilities need to be set up by the end of this month.", "", "
Kaurna elder Jeffrey Newchurch says work to set up a quarantine facility should have started earlier.(ABC Radio Adelaide: Troy Sincock)
", "Professor Spurrier said plenty of work had been done before the tender went out.", "\"We've already spoken to a large number of people who provide these sorts of facilities,\" she said.", "\"We have already scoped out where they may be but we need to go through a formal tender process as part of a procurement.\"", "Kaurna elder Jeffrey Newchurch argued the move had come too late.", "Opposition health spokesman Chris Picton questioned the timing of the move.", "\"Previously, the government had said it would be too difficult to operate any purpose-built quarantine facilities in South Australia and that's why we've had to use CBD hotels,\" he said.", "\"But now, apparently, with a tender of five days and another week after that they think that we will be able to set up some regional quarantine facilities.\"", "", "
Going overseas? Here's what you need to know
"]
